Welcome

This weekly lab is a required component of Computer Science 227. The purpose of the lab is to give you a chance to try things hands-on, in a smaller group than the lectures, where there are people around to talk to and a TA present to answer questions. The topics presented in the lab will generally follow along with the lectures.

Goals for today

There isn't much about programming as such just yet. In today's lab, we want to make sure you can:
  • Create and use a workspace on an ISU-managed network server
  • Find your files again when you need to submit an assignment
  • Create and run a simple Java program using the Eclipse development environment
  • Run a tool called the SpecChecker that will help to validate your assignments for this course
  • Submit an assignment on Blackboard and verify that it was correctly uploaded

Your first task

In order for the TA to record your lab scores, you'll need to sign up for the appropriate "group" on Blackboard.
  1. First, make sure you know your lab section number. It is on your schedule of classes. You can look it up in the TA list in the syllabus if you don't know.
  2. Next, sign in to Blackboard, go to Com S 227, and click on "Groups" in the menu on the left side.
  3. Click on "View Sign-up Sheet" and join the group corresponding to your lab section number.
